intro: Calochortus weedii var. albus, commonly known as the White Ghost Lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white petals and showy floral display. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces a single, erect stem with a cluster of white flowers. The White Ghost Lily is often found in California and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils.
